title._content: [Lewis Hicks of Company H, 53rd North Carolina Infantry Regiment with pistol in front of backdrop showing a gabled house] (LOC)

description._content: [Lewis Hicks of Company H, 53rd North Carolina Infantry Regiment with pistol in front of backdrop showing a gabled house] [1863] 1 photograph : sixth-plate ambrotype, hand-colored ; 9.7 x 8.3 cm (case) Notes: Title devised by Library staff. Case: Leather; oval surrounded by scrolls. Photograph shows identified soldier, Lewis Hicks, who enlisted in Company H, 53rd North Carolina Infantry Regiment, as a private on March 2, 1863 and died of disease on July 20, 1863. Deposit; Tom Liljenquist; 2011; (D 062). Purchased from: The Historical Shop, Metairie, La., 2011. Forms part of: Liljenquist Family Collection of Civil War Photographs (Library of Congress). Subjects: Hicks, Lewis,--d. 1863. Confederate States of America.--Army.--North Carolina Infantry Regiment, 53rd--People--1860-1870. Soldiers--Confederate--1860-1870. Military uniforms--Confederate--1860-1870. Handguns--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military personnel--Confederate. Format: Portrait photographs--1860-1870. Tintypes--Hand-colored--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Ambrotype/Tintype filing series (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650518 Liljenquist Family collection (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650519 More information about this collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.lilj Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.31463 Call Number: AMB/TIN no. 2706
